text: Julie Le Breton (born 1975) is a French Canadian actress born in Arvida, Quebec. She predominantly appears in French-language television series and films. ==Biography== She is best known internationally for her appearance in The Rocket, a French Canadian biopic about legendary ice hockey player Maurice "The Rocket" Richard. In this Charles Binamé interpretation, she plays Lucille Richard, the wife of the main character starring Roy Dupuis. For her appearance, she got a nomination for the Jutra Award and won the Genie Award for best leading actress. She started her career with a leading role in the national television series Watatatow, and often acts in local television drama. ==Films== {| class="wikitable" |- ! style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Year !
